Articles.Content: Have you started working on the new version 0.4 again? If not, no need to rush.
Love these rockets, great work. And my condolences for what your family is going through
Please add a 0.22 compatibility.
When will you start working on this again?
Please launch the Apollo crafts.
Could you put in the central engine of Saturn V as a separate model? The reason is that it shuts down earlier than the rest to reduce the G loads on the crew.

With you again. I'm sorry that so long did not answer and did not unsubscribe to progress. It was very busy and there was not really time. Now version 0.4. Rockets are adapted under version 0.22. Reworking atlas not completed in version 0.4 it will go in the intermediate state. Maud will obnavlen to version 0.4a (alfa) in a few days.
:rolleyes:I would like to know how can we player get the size of models.I'm trying to make realistic rockets in a real size to play in RSS.But I don't know the current size.

:rolleyes:I would like to know how can we player get the size of models.I'm trying to make realistic rockets in a real size to play in RSS.But I don't know the current size.

what size you need? rockets were drawn by on sketches and drawings and fit the size of the game that scale.
He means that he, for example, wants a 10 m tank for the Saturn V and wonders how to scale it
The LEO payload of a Saturn V was 118tonnens not the mere 90 you have

3ds Max or Unity )

version 0.4a0 release

Edited December 3, 2013 by Lovad

3ds Max or Unity )

Now Saturn into orbit 140 tonnes

version 0.4a0 release

Well, release now? Good that I saw it Didn't expected that the update would be here so fat. By the way good to see, you are back here again

Lovad--great to see you back!

As long as the rockets are in proportion, rescaling in KSP is no trouble. It's only if, for example, the rocket is 64% the diameter it is in real life but 50% the height, then there's a problem.

Also: would you mind if someone made real-life [real 100% scale, real stats) cfg patches for these rockets? They're _perfect_ for it.

Lovad--great to see you back!

As long as the rockets are in proportion, rescaling in KSP is no trouble. It's only if, for example, the rocket is 64% the diameter it is in real life but 50% the height, then there's a problem.

Also: would you mind if someone made real-life [real 100% scale, real stats) cfg patches for these rockets? They're _perfect_ for it.

Thank you, I am also glad to be back. Can be done and the real size, but I'm afraid with nekotoromi rockets at assembly will have problems particularly with Saturn 5

Congrats on the new release. BTW, I've found a few issues.

1. Saturn V staging. Aside from missing retrorockets and ullage motors, the S-I/S-II connection separated in two stages. First, S-I disconnected and S-II ullage motors fired, igniting J-2 engines. About 10 seconds after that, the interstage was decoupled. I think that you should try to model that, it wouldn't be hard.

2. Saturn V engine cutoff. On both S-I and S-II, the center engine was slightly different than the rest. It had no gimbal and shut down earlier than the other four. That would be especially useful with 1:1 scaled Saturn.

3. Titan IV boosters you modeled are not USRMs, but UA1207s. USRMs look different.

Any chance that in the future you could have a crack at the British Black Arrow rocket? I know someone has already made one but its in desperate need of some work and I think the mod is dead (its still 0.19.1). Given your excellent work so far I thought you are one of a few people who could do it justice!

Loving the work so far Lovad!!

Edited December 30, 2013 by Cdodders
Someone made that previously, Wasn't compatible with .20 and was rather OP. Skeligandrew was his name.
His Black Arrow was rather broken, though. Now it's completely unusable. I've got the model source files, so if anyone wants to try fixing it, PM me.
Relatively useful light load launcher that is also quite small, plus its the first (and I think) only British designed and built rocket to put a payload into orbit (Prospero X-3)

Relatively useful light load launcher that is also quite small, plus its the first (and I think) only British designed and built rocket to put a payload into orbit (Prospero X-3)

Technically the blue streak element of the Europa-1 rocket was British and the Cora upper stages were French, so Europa was an Anglo-French design, but still part British.
And we all know how that project ended (Coralie kept failing, UK withdrew, ELDO died, Arianespace was created), so Black Arrow remains the only British LV.
Hope someone can give it a decent workover
Is this compatible with KSP 0.23? I want to play this, but I don't want my game going like Danny2462's game(on YouTube; look him up!)...
Dude, its only parts, they don't affect the game.
